Key Match Events: Jakob Poeltl scored nine points in the third quarter
Toronto scored six consecutive points in the final two minutes of play to make it a one-possession game with 15.3 seconds left
Ochai Agbaji fouled Jaden Ivey, who made one of two free throws for a three-point Pistons lead
Dick missed a three-pointer after a Toronto timeout with 9.1 seconds left
Pre-Game Insights: Toronto head coach Darko Rajakovic joked pre-game that if his team was going to get to Boston on time, they had to avoid overtime against the Pistons to beat the rush hour caused by Taylor Swift's concert letting out from nearby Rogers Centre
Post-Match Reflections: Cunningham, Beasley and fellow guard Jaden Ivey are typically the engine that drives the Pistons' offence but Toronto's defence is geared toward stifling perimeter play and those three were harassed into underperforming
Poeltl has been a consistent presence for the Raptors all season and Friday was no different
Detroit centre Jalen Duren made one of two free throws to finish the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: Toronto had 15 turnovers and Detroit had 14
Toronto stayed out of foul trouble, only giving out 13 personal fouls
